title: Retail & E-commerce Interview Guide
description: Understand the fast-paced, customer-obsessed world of retail and e-commerce.

content.text: Retail operates on thin margins with fierce competition. Speed, customer obsession, and operational excellence separate winners from losers. Companies want people who thrive in this intensity.

**Core retail values:**

- **Customer obsession** - Start with the customer, work backwards
- **Speed to market** - First-mover advantage matters
- **Data-driven merchandising** - Decisions backed by sales data
- **Omnichannel thinking** - Seamless online + offline experience
- **Cost consciousness** - Every penny of margin counts
There's only one boss: the customer. And they can fire everybody in the company from the chairman on down, simply by spending their money somewhere else.
content.author: Sam Walton, Walmart Founder

content.text: Retail has its own language of KPIs. Familiarity with these metrics shows you understand how the business operates.

items.text: Same-store sales (comp sales) - Growth in existing locations
Gross margin - Revenue minus cost of goods sold
Inventory turnover - How fast products sell
Customer acquisition cost (CAC) - Cost to gain a customer
Lifetime value (LTV) - Total customer relationship value
Conversion rate - Visitors who become buyers

content.text: For e-commerce roles, also know: cart abandonment rate, average order value (AOV), return rate, and fulfillment cost per order.
Every retail interview will touch on customer experience. Prepare examples of how you've improved customer outcomes or designed with customers in mind.

content.question: A customer complains about a policy that's clearly stated on your website. What's the best approach?

options.text: Point them to where the policy is documented
Enforce the policy consistently to be fair to other customers
Empathize first, then find a solution that keeps them as a customer
Escalate to a manager to avoid making a wrong decision

content.explanation: Customer-obsessed companies empower employees to solve problems. Leading with empathy and finding creative solutions shows the customer-first mindset retailers prize.

content.text: Retail is evolving rapidly. Show you understand where the industry is heading, not just where it's been.

**Current trends:**

- **Unified commerce** - Seamless integration across all channels
- **Social commerce** - Shopping directly through social platforms
- **Sustainability** - Consumer demand for ethical, eco-friendly options
- **Personalization** - AI-driven product recommendations
- **Last-mile innovation** - Same-day delivery, BOPIS, curbside pickup
- **Subscription models** - Recurring revenue through memberships
